caption: Very beautiful! Maybe about 1.5 miles long from start to finish? I visited around 3pm and it wasn't crowded at all. It's prly in my top 3 fave "parks" out of all the other ones I've been to in Paris (about 10 in total). Highly recommended on a sunny day esp

Lovely walk that inspired the NYC high line. Lots of golden foliage and tons of views on old Paris building facades. A few joggers and lots of walkers. Nice way to spend an hour relaxing always from the bustle of the city.

One of the best park experiences in this city. Well cared for, quiet, narrow passage for walking and picnics, much of it above shops and restaurants (west end). Benches and views along the way, joins the more rustic Petite Ceinture belt walkway on the east end.

It reminds me of the high line in New York Almost 1.2 km walk enjoyable between green lush leaves. Hidden Gems away from tourists mainly frequented by locals. So enjoyable with an overdose of oxygen Beware of slippery areas due to rainfall

I walked the entirety of coulee verte from Vincennes to Bastille. It was a really lovely walk, in some places it felt a little more run down than most but it's generally a really well maintained route with both art and nature. A nice escape from bustling streets. When I reached the end, there were only stairs to get down to street level so I had to walk back about 10-15 mins to the last elevator I passed to get down. They should find a way to add an elevator at the end, by the stairs. For kids, there was also a good playground around half way along.
The High Line of Paris!!!! Elevated footpath,  surrounded by beautiful vegetation!!! Nice for a quiet stroll!
Welcome oasis when we had a couple of hours to kill at the Gare de Lyon. Shaded walk, nicely busy, water fountains even a lift or two to avoid the stairs
Me and my other half fave to spend the days eating our packed lunch, having deeply talk and share our moments.

Coulée Verte René-Dumont, formerly an old viaduct, has been transformed into a beautiful elevated park in Paris. This green space offers a lovely walking path where visitors can enjoy a peaceful stroll or sit on one of the many benches. As you walk along the path, you can admire the charming houses and the well-maintained greenery that surrounds you.  One of the highlights of this park is its tranquility. Despite being located in the bustling city of Paris, the noise of the traffic below is minimal, allowing visitors to feel a sense of calm and escape from the urban hustle. Additionally, the park is pleasantly uncrowded and very clean, providing a serene environment for relaxation.  Overall, Coulée Verte René-Dumont is a hidden gem in Paris, perfect for those looking to enjoy a quiet and scenic walk above the city’s streets.
Nice walk, quiet and full of flowers (spring-summer) not so much tourism, a good place to visit.

defo recommend this. for walking. running here is only possible in winter, when there are less/no people. there’s signs everywhere saying running is allowed, but if it doesn’t disturb the calm of the space/ the people on their walks.

Such a pretty & quiet spot away from the tourist crowds.. the roses were in bloom while I was visiting, which made the park even more beautiful. Highly recommend visiting this elevated park if you have some spare time. Perfect for a lunch picnic or to get some exercise in.

Probably was the inspiration for the High Line in Manhattan, in that at the narrowest part, three people can walk side by side, so be considerate and don’t use up all the space. Lots of access points, from the west side, we entered through the corner of Av. Daumesnil / Av. Ledru Rollin and exited at the east at Rue Jacques Hillairet, around 1.3 km of walking. That being said, it’s a lovely walk with lots of landscaping, architecture, scenery, foliage and artworks to look at. Benches are available at some points.

Similar to the high line in NYC, the Coulee Verte is a great place to walk with children as they can run freely without the worry of traffic. The walkway is lined with places to rest and offers great views of the city. The landscaping is beautiful and there is a lovely pond with koi. There are many entries and exits off the path and back onto the street.

A delightful repurposing of an old elevated rail line. Wonderful plantings, well looked after, makes for a beautiful and refreshing area. Popular with walkers, joggers, folks chilling on lunch break, so clearly appreciated.

Such a beautiful place for a stroll. Great views of the Paris streets from above and lovely landscaping with benches sprinkled along the way. I've been wanting to come here, as this was the inspiration for the High Line park in NYC which is one of my favorite spots. It certainly did not disappoint.

The Coulee-Verte is an above-ground, train track walkway that is definitely worth visiting when you’re in Paris next! It was finished in 1974, 20 years before New York City’s “High Line“, and served as a model for NYC. I walked the northern part of it, towards Bastille, which felt like it was about a mile. Apparently there’s another section of it, which I haven’t found yet. But what a beautiful sanctuary from the loud, hectic city life below!  [Film location note: the Coulee Verte was featured in the film “Before Sunset“ - featuring Ethan Hawke and Julie Delpy.]

Magical place, this area is just a great example of what a mixed use area could be. It was an absolute joy walking through this. The park has a little bamboo patch, many rose beds, right above probably one of the most interesting streets of Paris where workshops were the store fronts.

It's easy to miss this place if you don't research Paris beforehand or if you aren't a local. This skyline garden trail was wonderful to experience and served as the perfect backdrop for my sister's engagement photos. I could have spent the whole day here easily. Please don't skip this, it'll be one of your favorite Parisian activities if you go. And it's free!
Nice green walkway, green dog friendly walks are lacking so this was a real pleasure.
Exceptional elevated linear park on historic railways, strongly deserves a visit as it's close to central Paris but with a green unique walk perspective

A perfect trail in the heart of Paris. This was a great running spot for my fiancé and I. The streets are overcrowded and difficult to run in. This mile long route was exactly what we needed. Very green and provides decent views as well.

Very nice walk in the heart of paris. We can actually forget for a moment the big city rythme. You can go all the way to Vincennes if you follow the trail all the way. It’s not a dirt road so you just need regular walking shoes. Enjoy
Fantastic place.  We did this walk on a Sunday when there was also a great market on at Bastille.  A very relaxing walk.

A somewhat less-known spot in Paris but it’ll give you all the vibes. A refuge from the busy city on the elevated former railway line. You can observe the 12th Arrondisement from the peace and quiet. If you follow it until the end, it will be a good 5km walk (all the way to the Vincennes Wood). Highly recommended in spring, when the beautiful trees are in bloom.

It is a hidden secret in the city, almost feel like the highline of Paris! You can walk along in the elevated park to view the street and neighborhood from a different perspective.  The scenery changes along the sections so make sure you spend time to walk as much as you can. I personally loved the pond section, very serene and relaxing.  Most of time only people in the neighborhood go, not many people in Paris even know about this place.
A magical walkway in between plants and flowers, above the daily street life, next to Parisian house facades and rooftops.  Lost in thought and motion. My Paris happy place nr. 1 - So nice.

A green oazis à blooming garden an escape from a big and noisy city. So unexpected place to walk, jog or just sit and relax. A path that goes for 4.5 km, but you can quite on many ocations. With a drinking water 'fountains' and public toilets along. I would call it a hidden gem of Paris. So different from other tourist attractions. If you start from the part that is close to the Bastille you enter the garden of roses and flowers. IMHO the part up until the garden is more nicer and has more sun light cource after it's more like a forest that is of course nice too but can be too long of you are for a short visit to Paris.

“Le Promenade Plantée” or the “Coulée Verte” is a 4.7km elevated Park built on the top of the obsolete in the 12th arrondissement of Paris, France.  According to Wikipedia, it was inaugurated in 1993.  We found this place while researching online and immediately thought it could be a great place to discover. Its a totally FREE activity that gives you a beautiful overview os the streets of Paris with all amazing buildings.  The park is easily accessed by metro. We recommend to visit on a nice day, or at least without rain, which could be tricky in Paris.  Luck was on our side since it was a beautiful sunny day when we visited.  We appreciated the nice street views.  Consider this place to take cool pictures of the green alley and beautiful buildings around.  We recommend it because it’s a really cool and green space in the middle of Paris.  Many locals go for a walk or get their daily dose of jogging.  To rest, you can sit on one of the benches and fill up your water at the water fountain.  We noticed shopping stores just down the entrance, but we didn’t stop to take a look.  Our Ratings Serge: 4  Eli:  4  Recommend: Yes, It’s a really cool and green space in the middle of Paris with amazing view of Paris streets.

This is a superb walking route on a disused railway line in Paris. You're elevated up above the hubbub of the day-to-day goings on and have wonderful views of the tree tops and buildings. Also known as the Promenade Plantée. It's not necessarily that easy to find and the starting point is a staircase tucked into an archway bridge at the crossroads of rue de Lyon and avenue Daumesnil. There are other staircases en route and lifts for disabled access- although these did not look like they working when we went (May 2022). People relaxing, dog walking, jogging and we also fed the birds. It's very tranquil and a quarter way along there's a roof top gym you can have a go on the apparatus. Highly recommend and a great get away for an hour or so from the busy city.
Beautiful green path and best choice for walking & talking time , with your family or friends in Paris. You have the nature & (old + new architecture) the city at the same time. 🤩 …
Great place to hide from big city rush. You can spend hours here, just walking among wonderful nature, and looking around on nearby buildings.

A great place to take walk in 12th arrondissement of Paris. elevated linear park built on top of obsolete railway infrastructure in the 12th arrondissement of Paris, France. It was inaugurated in 1993. Beginning just east of the Opéra Bastille with the elevated Viaduc des Arts, it follows a 4.7 km (2.9 miles) path eastward that ends at a spiral staircase leading to the boulevard Périphérique beltway.
Beautiful walking/jogging path! It was fairly popular and busy on a Saturday afternoon, but lots of spaces to stop and enjoy nature above the bustling city.
Incredible park sort of hidden in the city! Great picture stops,  deffinently worth the visit. Just watch out for the runners and enjoy the path.
Beautiful walkway, well worth seeking it out. Easy to get metro or bus back into central Paris .

Think Brooklyn Bridge in the middle of Paris. This is a re-purposed portion of railroad tracks that have been converted into a greenway complete with benches, spots to stop and rest, tons of flowers and tree and even public restrooms. Joggers welcome. No bikes. Enjoy this respite from the urban madness of Paris.

A small sky garden in Paris with a length of 4.5 km and a height of 10 m.  Previously, it was used as a railroad between Bastille and Port Dore, then converted into a promenade in 1988. Fun and interesting scenery brings joy and various shops are located in the building under the garden
